task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 262°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline of the main building straight ahead to estimate its height accurately, so I should tilt the camera upward first.
I’m now looking north and up, but the task is to face the building to the west (~262°), so I should rotate left to bring the target building back into view while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate height I need both the base and roofline in view at once, so I should tilt slightly upward to include the top of the building while keeping the facade visible.
The view has snapped back to north again, so I need to rotate to heading ~262° west to re-center the target building while keeping the current pitch.
I should move a bit closer to the building to better judge the number of stories and get a clearer roofline-to-ground reference.
After moving I'm facing south, so I need to rotate right to approximately 262° to face the target building again.
I'm facing east; to face the building at ~262° (west-southwest), I should rotate to the back direction near 258°.
To face ~262° from 180° I should rotate right about 82° to bring the west-southwest building into view.
The interface offers a direct back heading of 262°, which matches the target direction, so I should rotate to that heading.
I still need to reach heading ~262°, so I should rotate right 82° from 180° to align with the building.
From 82° the target 262° is exactly 180° behind me, so I should rotate 180° to face it.
The rotation commands seem to be snapping unexpectedly, so I'll use an absolute custom rotation to reach heading 262° by turning right 82° from 180°.
I should use the provided 'Look BACK' direction which is explicitly 262° to align with the target building.
To get from 180° to 262° I need a +82° yaw, so I'll rotate right 82° again to try to face the building.
The repeated rotations are not resulting in heading 262°, so I will instead move to a nearby node to potentially reset orientation and get a clearer view of the target building.
I need to face ~262° (west-southwest), so from 4° I should rotate left about 102° to reach 262°.
Now I’m correctly facing the building (close to 262°), so I should tilt up to include the roofline and estimate total height by counting stories.
The view reset to 0° again, so I must rotate back to ~262° while keeping the upward pitch to see the building’s top.
I’m aligned at 262°; to estimate height I need the roofline, so I should look up while keeping this heading fixed.
The heading reset again; I should rotate left to about 262° while staying pitched up to capture the building top.
Since looking up resets my heading, I’ll keep pitch at 0° and estimate height from visible stories: the main building appears about 3 stories plus a roof/parapet.
